result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony N Casiano was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Anthony N Casiano in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to the charge. Court imposed the following sentence: 

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT 
  -  1 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  1 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
 
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;  
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
 
FINE and COURT COSTS:  $4088.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME: 90 days jail with 94 days credit already served. 
PROBATION MAY BE TRANSFERRED TO THE STATE OF NEW YORK
APPLY ANY BAIL AND REFUND THE BALANCE TO THE POSTER

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant Anthony N Casiano in court, in custody, with attorney Andrew R Rider.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State is requesting additional cash bail. Defense objects and presents arguments.  Bail is reinstated.
Hearing on September 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
August 9, 2016, from ADA Andrea Will, unable to attend the August 11, 2016 Hearing. (Approved.  The court is adjourning the matter out for a status after Sept. 5th.)
Hearing on August 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Andrew R Rider in court.   Defendant Anthony N Casiano did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is still currently in custody in New York and has waived his extradition there and does not know why the defendant hasn't been picked up. Court orders the state is try and find out as to why he has not been picked up.  Hearing scheduled for August 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on August 8, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Andrew R Rider in court.   Defendant Anthony N Casiano did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant remains. Defense counsel stated that defendant was pick-up and is in custody in New York. Court sets the matter for status of the extradition hearing. Court revokes the bail.  Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Review hearing on July 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Anthony N Casiano in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is requesting appointment of counsel. Court grants and has attorney Andrew Rider appointed, who does accept the case. Parties tried to resolve the matter today, but do request a plea and sentencing date. Any attorney fees that are owed, will be taken out of the defendant's bail.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Steven Richard Kohn in court.   Defendant Anthony N Casiano appears by telephone.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Kohn is requesting to withdraw as counsel and presents his reasoning on the record. Court grants the requesting and adjourns the matter for the status of counsel. Defendant may appear by telephone if he provides a excuse from his doctor.  Hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Motion hearing on March 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.
filed by Attorney Kohn
Hearing at 03-18-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Anthony N Casiano in court with attorney Steven Richard Kohn.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for 60 days due to his clients medical condition and attorney Kohn would like to speak with Ms. Will. State has no objections. Court adjourns for 30 days and would like more information regarding the defendant's medical conditions. Defendant does not have to appear for the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-10-2016 10:00 am

Adjournment request filed by Attorney Kohn along with doctor's note.
